# RStudio + R Troubleshooting Cheat-Sheet

This guide is for students running **older macOS versions** who run into crashes or compatibility problems when using RStudio.

---

## Step 1 ‚Äî Identify Your macOS Version

Click the Apple menu ‚Üí **About This Mac**, and note your **macOS version** (e.g., 10.15, 11, 12).

---

## Step 2 ‚Äî Use the Correct RStudio for Your macOS

| macOS Version | Recommended RStudio Version |
|---------------|-----------------------------|
| 12 (Ventura) or newer | RStudio **2024.09.1+394** or later ([Posit Docs](https://docs.posit.co/supported-versions/rstudio.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) |
| 11 (Big Sur) | RStudio **2023.09.1+494** ([Posit Docs](https://docs.posit.co/supported-versions/rstudio.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) |
| 10.15 (Catalina) | RStudio **2022.07.2+576** ([Posit Docs](https://docs.posit.co/supported-versions/rstudio.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) |

## Step 3 ‚Äî Install a Supported R Version

Older Macs often **crash with R 4.5.x inside RStudio**. Choose a more stable option:

- **R 4.5.0** (released April 11, 2025): *may* be safe if needed ([CRAN download](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)).  
- **R 4.4.3 or 4.4.1**: **safest bets**. Both are available in CRAN‚Äôs macOS directory.  

**Where to find them:**

- [CRAN macOS binaries](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)  
- [Big Sur ARM64/Intel builds](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/big-sur-arm64/base/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)  
- [Helpful Stack Overflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/78093295/downloading-an-old-version-of-r-on-mac?utm_source=chatgpt.com)  

---

## Step 4 ‚Äî Do the 60-Second Console Check

Open **Terminal**, type:

```bash
R
1+1
````

* If it prints `2`, R is working fine.
* Next, open RStudio and try again.
* If RStudio crashes immediately or while typing ‚Üí it‚Äôs a **compatibility issue between R and RStudio**.

---

## Step 5 ‚Äî If it Still Crashes

* Downgrade R to **4.4.3** or **4.4.1**.
* If you must keep R 4.5.x, use an **older RStudio version** (see table above).
* Still stuck?

  * Clear RStudio‚Äôs user state (e.g., delete `~/.config/rstudio`).
  * Disable GPU rendering under **Preferences ‚Üí General ‚Üí Advanced**.

::: tip

2. Install a stable R (4.4.x is safest).
3. Test in Terminal. If it works there but not in RStudio ‚Üí compatibility bug.
4. Downgrade R or RStudio if needed.
5. Clean RStudio‚Äôs settings or turn off GPU if stubborn.
